instruction: How did the combination of NIR spectroscopy technology and the ML-ELM algorithm contribute to the rapid and non-destructive identification of the producing areas of flue-cured tobacco leaves in this study?
Output: The combination of NIR spectroscopy technology and the ML-ELM algorithm contributed to the rapid and non-destructive identification of the producing areas of flue-cured tobacco leaves in this study by achieving the highest accuracy, sensitivity, and specificity compared to traditional linear discriminant analysis (LDA) and extreme learning machine (ELM) algorithms. The ML-ELM algorithm demonstrated the best generalization ability and prediction results for different producing areas of Yunnan tobacco leaves. Additionally, the NIR spectroscopy technology, along with the ML-ELM algorithm, provided the best prediction performance using both the NIR spectral data and chemical index data. This combination allowed for the rapid, accurate, and non-destructive recognition of different producing areas of Yunnan tobacco leaves.
